column2: A jQuery plugin that offers a simplistic way of implementing Lion OS scrollbars.

Bug fix: use @options instead of options

This fixes the bug:

Uncaught ReferenceError: options is not defined

because there isn't a `options` variable but the `@options` instance field.

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jamesflorentino/nanoScrollerJS
Fix indentation error
Update master

Remove keyboard support. Re-factore code.

I removed the keyboard support event binding by default since the
keyboard works even without them (tested on latest build of Chrome,
Safari, Opera and Firefox). To enable this back for some weird reason,
do a {keyboardSupport: true} on initial load.

I refactored the code a bit. I

Other changes:
- moved the `$.extend({},defaults)` to where it's needed (during a
  NanoScroll instantiation)
- Added a removeEvents method call in addEvents.
- Added an visual illustration on how nanoScroller works. (will add
  these later in the README.md files)
Add semicolon in the css rule

Disable preventPageScrolling if no scrollbar.

I added a condition to prevent the preventPageScrolling mechanism if
the scrollbar isn't visible.

This is a fix for #71

Fix for margin issue on pane.

Margin values can now be applied to the pane element.

Change opacity value for pane element.

Fix for issue #67

Chrome has a text-rendering bug when animating elements with opacity
going to 1 from below.

Fix FireFox 12 bug when dragging the pane element

In FireFox 12, event.offsetY is undefined. I have resolved this by using
the e.originalEvent.layerY instead.

Other changes:

- Added a custom GitHub ribbon named `gh-ribbon.png` located in `bin/images/`
- Changed the homepage url from my domain to its GitHub public repository.

Updated README
I updated the instructions in the README file according to level of
immediate importance.

Updated README.
I removed my original 'From the Author' paragraph to give credits to the other
contributors.

Added example sites so people can see it live in action.

Add conditional return statements for event handlers.
As to prevent producing javascript errors, I have added a condition
where it ignores any lines of code that uses the event callback data
(see events.scroll and events.wheel).

I have also enabled the settings to be applied even after the first
definition of the scrollbar data of a jquery object.
(see line 265 of coffeescripts/jquery.nanoscroller.coffee).
This is done so that developers can later enable settings on a
later phase. Example scenario would be a global settings for all
the nanoScrollers present in the page while still maintaining a
unique settings for each of them if needed.
Change for conditional evaluation.

Reverted obj.on() and obj.off() to obj.bind() and obj.unbind().
Used block strings for appending html in the element.
Forgot to remove console.log. This is a fix for the previous commit.

Removed the conditional return statements on  method.
Reason is that, we should be able to force it to scroll to the bottom.
I'm not even sure why I had it in there in the first place.

Other changes:
Changed @isDead to @stopped because the former's ambiguity.

Added method chaining for the @addEvents method and replaced 'bind' with 'on'.
Similar thing done to @removeEvents

Cleaned up code and added comments on the @reset method.

It may have added a few weight in terms of file size, but I prefer
having a comprehensive code that's easy to improve and update.

Added explanation to the formula for the scrolling mechanism in the
@scroll method.

Added makefile for development preview.

On a personal note: Seriously, good job guys. I've seen the changes and just wanna say
thank you for contributing and helping the plugin work better. Special shoutout to @kristerkari
for the continuous updates.
Update nanoscroller to support disable resize option (useful to have total control of the resize event and have more performance if scroll doesn't need to be resized).
